definition: to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards

sentences.english: By the way, I couldn't add the skip function again.
sentences.chinese: 趁便說一句，莪不能參加跳過成果了。

sentences.english: We took the opportunity of visiting the palace.
When you go back， would you take a message for me?
sentences.chinese: 你回去的時候，趁便給我帶個口信。

sentences.english: I dropped in on him on my way home.
sentences.chinese: 我在回來的路上趁便去他家看了看。

sentences.english: Conveniently checked total solar eclipse was visible material.
sentences.chinese: 趁便查啦一下日全食地材料。

sentences.english: By the way, Would you like a copy of the latest"TIME"?
sentences.chinese: 趁便問一下，您能否要一本最新的《時期》雜誌？

sentences.english: By the way, I'm working undercover at this moment.
sentences.chinese: 趁便說一下，我如今正隱祕工作。

sentences.english: He usually drops in at my place on hellos way home.
sentences.chinese: 他常常在回家的路上趁便來看看我。

sentences.english: Bnd by the way, could I have a look at your room card?
sentences.chinese: 趁便問一句，我可以看一下您的房卡嗎？

definition: to return a compliment/to give a return present
to call to pay one's respect/to call on
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
recently/until now/up to the present/lately/also written 爾來|尔来
